title: Measuring CN content in leaf samples using Elementar Vario MICRO Cube
title_html: Measuring CN content in leaf samples using Elementar Vario MICRO Cube

protocol.title: Measuring CN content in leaf samples using Elementar Vario MICRO Cube
protocol.title_html: Measuring CN content in leaf samples using Elementar Vario MICRO Cube

source.description: With a microbalance, put 7 mg (+/-0.2mg) of sample in a tin boat.

With a microbalance, put 2 mg (+/-0.2mg) of acetanilide in a tin boat. With tweezers, gently and carefully close the boat. Using the pressing tool, slowly press the boat to remove any remaining air. Weigh.

source.body: Calculate 4 acetanilid standards (for instrument conditioning) + 1 acetanilid standard for each 10 samples.

source.description: Check gaz pressure on manometers. Helium should be 1.2 bar, oxygen should be 2 bar.
Launch Variomicroselect software. There is no password.Click OK.
On main screen, check if combustion tube temperature is 950°C and reduction tube is 550°C.

source.body: If it is in blue and flashing, it means it is heating up and will reach correct temperatures after few minutes.
If not, you can modify by clicking on Options> Settings>Parameters… and change manually the temperatures.

source.description: On main screen, check the meter flow: TCD should be 200 mL/min; helium should be 200 mL/min; oxygen should be 13 mL/min.
With tweezers, gently and carefully close the boat. Using the pressing tool, slowly press the boat to remove any remaining air.
Weigh again and note. You will use this in the software before starting the analysis (see step 22).

source.body: Prepare all your samples the same way. Prepared samples should be placed in 24-well plates and stored in a dessicator while waiting for the analysis to get started.

source.description: On main screen, have a look on general components by clicking on Maintenance.

source.body: If some components are in orange, see with the lab manager if you need to perform a maintenance.

source.description: Open the front door of the Vario MICRO Cube. If the drying tube is mostly white, close the front door and go ahead with next step.

source.body: If the drying tube is 2/3 blue, contact the lab manager for a maintenance.

source.description: Click on Option -> Diagnostics -> Rough leak test
A window will open, saying to wait until columns are cooled. Press OK.
After 10 minutes, the window will show «Leak test passed» or «Leak test failed». Click Cancel.

source.body: If the leak test has failed, see the lab manager.

source.description:
On main screen, write in the table, on rows 1 to 6:
Weight (mg): 100
Name: MT
Method: Blank without O2
Click Yes
Wait for few minutes until the ads. column temperature is below 30°C and then press Start.
Press green button to start the analysis.

source.body:
The results (N Area and C Area) should be below 100 after few analysis.
If it is not the case, contact the lab manager.

source.description:
On row 7 and 8, write:
Weight (mg): put the weight of 2 acetanilid boats, prepared in step 4.
Name: RunIn
Method: 2mgChem70s

On row 9 and 10, write:
Weight (mg): 100
Name: Blank
Method: Blank with O2
Go to System --> Carousel position

On row 11 and 12, write:
Weight (mg): put the weight of 2 acetanilid boats, prepared in step 4.
Name: acetanilid
Method: 2mgChem70s

On rows 13 to 23, write:
Weight (mg): put the weight of prepared boats (see steps 1-3).
Name: Sample name (cover of sample bottle)
Method: 9mgPlant90s

On row 24, write:
Weight (mg): 100
Name: Blank
Method: Blank with O2

source.body: Many series can be run in the same day. Between 2 series of 10 samples, put 2 blanks (Blank with O2) and 1 acetanilid (2mgChem70s). The last row should be a blank.

source.description: Put prepared boats in the carousel. Numbers from carousel holes are corresponding to the software rows. Leave carousel hole empty when corresponding to a blank. Put back the carousel cover.
Press green button to start the analysis.

source.title: Saving data & shut down the instrument

source.description: Go to File --> Save as

source.title: Saving data & shut down the instrument

source.description:
Export data:
Go to File --> Export/Import --> Export sheet data (for Excel)...

Click on All samples removed from the carousel
and choose Reference run

source.title: Saving data & shut down the instrument

source.description: Write the date (YYYY-MM-DD) and name of the project or student and press Save.

source.title: Saving data & shut down the instrument

source.description: And then select Labo Laliberté and the project/student. Press Enregistrer.

source.title: Saving data & shut down the instrument

source.description: Make sure the instrument is on sleeping mode before leaving the lab. Have a look at the bottom of the screen.

source.body:
To put the instrument on sleeping mode, click on the moon on main screen
and on Sleep now...

source.description: Select Confirm actions... Click on Close and then Finish.

description: Here we describe the standardised protocol used by the Canadian Airborne Biodiversity Observatory (CABO) to measure CN content in leaf samples, using the Elementar Vario MICRO Cube.
